item.title: Probation for 2 teens over supermarket drink sampling incident during Covid-19 outbreak
item.description:
August 27, 2020 10:21 AM

SINGAPORE - Two teenagers linked to a drink sampling incident in a supermarket amid the Covid-19 outbreak were each sentenced to probation on Thursday (Aug 27).

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on Aug 27
item.description:
August 27, 2020 7:45 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Thursday, Aug 27.

item.title: Cancer-stricken woman gets fine instead of one week's jail
item.description:
August 27, 2020 5:00 AM

The apex court has made a rare ruling to grant judicial mercy to a woman with terminal cancer by converting her jail term of one week for contempt of court to a $5,000 fine.

item.title: Doctored Obama photos: Co-founder of BN Group Evangeline Shen maintains her silence
item.description:
August 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Requests to speak to Ms Shen through her lawyers and sent to her e-mail over the past few days have so far been unsuccessful.

item.title: Nominations open for this year's Silent Heroes Awards
item.description:
August 27, 2020 5:00 AM

For volunteer medical practitioner Bhavani Sriram, patience and diagnosis go hand in hand.

item.title: $82 million lost in six months through 10 main types of scams
item.description:
August 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Fraudsters are having a field day with a huge rise in the number of people cheated in online scams.

item.title: Prison for conman who went on the run for 19 years
item.description:
August 27, 2020 5:00 AM

A man went on the run for about 19 years after cheating three people of more than $6,600 in total.

item.title: Baby male Malayan tapir is new star of the Night Safari
item.description:
August 27, 2020 5:00 AM

The Night Safari has welcomed the latest addition to its Malayan tapir family - its first male calf in close to a decade.

item.title: ERP fee to go up $1 at 2 CTE gantries, reinstated at another
item.description:
August 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Motorists will have to pay more in Electronic Road Pricing fees when driving on part of the Central Expressway during peak hours from next Monday.

item.title: Over 6,300 jobs, training roles available in manufacturing
item.description:
August 27, 2020 5:00 AM

More than 6,300 jobs, traineeships, attachments and training opportunities are on offer from nearly 1,000 companies in the manufacturing sector for local job seekers.

item.title: Punctured artery, vein led to man's death
item.description:
August 27, 2020 5:00 AM

A kidney disease patient at Tan Tock Seng Hospital (TTSH) died in 2016 from acute haemorrhage after an artery and vein were accidentally punctured during the catheter insertion procedure for his peritoneal dialysis.

item.title: Wrestler grabs hold of life after troubled past
item.description:
August 27, 2020 5:00 AM

He was constantly stealing from his family members, be it a cellphone, a laptop or even hard-earned savings, and then one day he brought drugs home.

About 18,000 jobs and skills training opportunities in the information and communications technology (ICT) sector are currently available to Singaporeans across the digital economy.

item.title: $4,000 fine for host of circuit breaker gathering
item.description:
August 27, 2020 5:00 AM

One of the hosts of an unlawful gathering in a Sengkang flat amid the Covid-19 outbreak was fined $4,000 yesterday.

item.title: Three workers in motor trade charged over $12k in bribes
item.description:
August 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Three men in the motor trade were charged on Tuesday with offering and accepting bribes of about $12,000 between 2016 and 2017.

After spending more than two decades in the information technology (IT) and telecommunications industry, Mr Paul Chua, 48, last year decided to try something new.

Maintenance work being carried out on the exterior of Jewel Changi Airport yesterday.

item.title: Help for mid-career job seekers to move into biomedical roles
item.description:
August 27, 2020 5:00 AM

More help will be given to local mid-career job seekers to move into new roles in Singapore's biomedical science sector, even as the nation continues to position itself as a regional hub to draw in investments and jobs in this area.

item.title: Singapore, Thailand to speed up talks on green lane for travel
item.description:
August 27, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore and Thailand have agreed to speed up discussions on setting up a reciprocal green lane for essential business travel between them, said Singapore's Ministry of Foreign Affairs yesterday.

item.title: China-bound passengers turn up for last-minute Covid-19 test
item.description:
August 27, 2020 5:00 AM

The authorities said there are more time slots for China-bound passengers to get the necessary tests for Covid-19 after scores of anxious passengers showed up at the former Shuqun Secondary School yesterday to be tested.

Singapore's beauty industry is getting a skills facelift with the launch of a new framework to help more than 13,000 workers in the industry to plan their career and development pathways.
